719932f-a.title: Manhattan: Fulton Street - South Street
719932f-a.text:
Fulton Street, north side, west from but not including South, to and including Front Streets. The view shows the south side of the
Fulton Street Fish Market.
1923.
P. L. Sperr.
Neg.w S22
719932f-a.folder: Fulton Street & South Street, Manhattan, NY

723286f-a.title: Manhattan: South Street - Fulton Street
723286f-a.text:
South Street, east side, at the foot of Fulton Street, showing the ferry house of the former Fulton Street Ferry, which was operated to Fulton Street in Brooklyn, by the Union Ferry Co. Adjacent to same, on the south, is Pier No. 16, East River, ocoupied by the United Fruit Co. Across the background, appears the Proollgn Bridge. This set consists of three views, more or less
similar; taken at the same time.
July 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
723286f-a.folder: South Street & Fulton Street, Manhattan, NY

723279f-c.title: Manhattan: South Street - Fulton Street
723279f-c.text:
(1)
9S to 88 South Street, west side, south from and including Fulton Street (right), to and including Burling Slip, as seen from Pier 17, East River. Also shown, is Fulton Street, south side, west fom South Street. In the background is visible a general view of the tall buildings dominating the immediate area, with the tower of the Woolworth Building on the
extrege right.
A7 September 23, 1931.  NEG ~ 3NN7
'. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing a closer view.
September 23, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
Neeg.~ 15hO
(3)
The same, as seen from the east side of the street. Also shown, is a close view of Nos. 4 to 14 Fulton Street, adjoining and west of
the S.W. corner of South Street.
NEO A 3198  September 23, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

723280f-a.title: Manhattan: South Street - Fulton Street
723280f-a.text:
93-89 South Street (left), at, adjoining and south of the S.W. corner of Fu1ton Street. Also shown are Nos. 4 and 6 Fulton Street (right), adjoining and west of the S.N. cornor of South Street. No. 93 (the corner house), eoes not bear any numbers on the latter street. Prominently silhouetted against the sky, are (left to right), the Farmer's Loan and Trust Co.; 60 Wdall Strect
Tower and the Bank of Manhattan Buildinga.
N1wc9  NWEG~ M:  May 29, 1932.
/
P. L. Sperr.

723281f-a.title: Manhattan: South Street - Fulton Street
723281f-a.text:
100 South Street, west side, between Fulton and Shown is a portien of Folton Market.
1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Writers Project.
fP Su:.

723287f-a.title: Manhattan: South Street - Fulton Street
723287f-a.text:
South Street, east side, north from the foot of Fulton Street, showing the southerly unit of the Fulton Fish Market pier buildings. The northerly unit is just beyond and is totally obscured from view. Note the Brooklyn Bridge in the background.
1: August 2, 1937
2: Sept. 3, 1940
P. L. Sperr
723287f-a.folder: South Street & Fulton Street, Manhattan, NY
